fustian noun [U]
(CLOTH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a thick, rough cotton cloth that lasts for a long time: About 1577, a certain type of fustian became popular in the city of Genoa. It was no hardship to clothe herself in fustian and feed on oats.

fustian noun [U]
(SELF-IMPORTANCE)
behaviour or writing that is too serious or formal, and in which you try to appear or sound more important or intelligent than you really are: The line is worth a hundred pages of fustian. Despite the fustian, Mandler's argument is smart and clear and appears to be sound.
